00026 /*
00027  * Syntax tree implementation for amule-PHP interpreter.
00028  */

00039 #define YY_NO_UNISTD_H

00044 #if !defined PRIu64
00045 # if defined(__alpha__) || defined(__ia64__) || defined(__ppc64__) || defined(__x86_64__) \

00053 typedef enum PHP_VALUE_TYPE {
00054     /* simple values */
00055     PHP_VAL_NONE, PHP_VAL_INT, PHP_VAL_FLOAT, PHP_VAL_STRING, PHP_VAL_BOOL,
00056     /* both point to same map<string, var> but meaning is different */
00057     PHP_VAL_ARRAY, PHP_VAL_OBJECT,
00058     /* Internally used (not ref counted) data */
00059     PHP_VAL_INT_DATA,
00060     /* ptr_val points to VAR_NODE */
00061     PHP_VAL_VAR_NODE
00062 } PHP_VALUE_TYPE;
00063 
00064 typedef struct PHP_VALUE_NODE {
00065     PHP_VALUE_TYPE type;
00066     union {
00067         uint64_t int_val;
00068         double float_val;
00069         char *str_val;
00070         /* used for arrays and internal objects:
00071          * * array contain std::map of key:value pairs
00072          * * object contain internally interpreted data
00073          */
00074         void *ptr_val;
00075         struct {
00076             void *inst_ptr;
00077             const char *class_name;
00078         } obj_val;
00079     };
00080 } PHP_VALUE_NODE;
00081 
00082 /*
00083  * Flags for different variable types/usages
00084  */
00085 
00086 #define PHP_VARFLAG_STATIC      0x0001
00087 #define PHP_VARFLAG_GLOBAL      0x0002
00088 #define PHP_VARFLAG_BYREF       0x0004
00089 
00090 /*
00091   Data about variable.
00092 */
00093 typedef struct PHP_VAR_NODE {
00094     PHP_VALUE_NODE value;
00095     /* php support references */
00096     int ref_count;
00097     int flags;
00098 } PHP_VAR_NODE;
00099 
00100 
00101 /*
00102  Node in expression tree. Contain either (left op right) or (value)
00103 */
00104 typedef enum PHP_EXP_OP {
00105     PHP_OP_VAR, PHP_OP_VAL, PHP_OP_ASS,
00106     
00107     /* dereference */
00108     PHP_OP_ARRAY_BY_KEY, PHP_OP_VAR_BY_EXP,
00109     
00110     /* array construct */
00111     PHP_OP_ARRAY, PHP_OP_ARRAY_PAIR, PHP_OP_ARRAY_REF_PAIR,
00112     
00113     /* object access "->" and "::" */
00114     PHP_OP_OBJECT_DEREF, PHP_OP_CLASS_DEREF,
00115  
00116     /* casting */
00117     PHP_OP_CAST_INT, PHP_OP_CAST_FLOAT, PHP_OP_CAST_BOOL, PHP_OP_CAST_STR,
00118     
00119     /* arithmetics */
00120     PHP_OP_MUL, PHP_OP_DIV, PHP_OP_ADD, PHP_OP_SUB, PHP_OP_REM,
00121     /* str concat */
00122     PHP_OP_CAT,
00123     /* bits */
00124     PHP_OP_SHL, PHP_OP_SHR, PHP_OP_OR, PHP_OP_AND, PHP_OP_XOR, PHP_OP_NOT,
00125     /* logical */
00126     PHP_OP_LOG_OR, PHP_OP_LOG_AND, PHP_OP_LOG_XOR, PHP_OP_LOG_NOT,
00127     /* compare */
00128     PHP_OP_EQ, PHP_OP_NEQ, PHP_OP_SAME, PHP_OP_NOT_SAME,
00129     PHP_OP_GRT, PHP_OP_GRT_EQ, PHP_OP_LWR, PHP_OP_LWR_EQ,
00130 
00131     /* conditional assign (mux) */
00132     PHP_OP_MUX,
00133     
00134     /* specials */
00135     PHP_OP_FUNC_CALL, PHP_OP_PRINT, PHP_OP_ECHO, PHP_MAKE_REF,
00136     /* list of expressions */
00137     PHP_OP_LIST,
00138     /* for "switch" list of cases */
00139     PHP_OP_CASE
00140 } PHP_EXP_OP;
00141 
00142 struct PHP_EXP_NODE {
00143     PHP_EXP_OP op;
00144     union {
00145         struct {
00146             struct PHP_EXP_NODE *left;
00147             /* In the 'switch' statement expression points
00148              * to beginning of code*/
00149             union {
00150                 struct PHP_EXP_NODE *right;
00151                 struct PHP_SYN_NODE *syn_right;
00152             };
00153         } tree_node;
00154         struct PHP_EXP_NODE *next;
00155     };
00156     union {
00157         PHP_VALUE_NODE val_node;
00158         // for "internal" variables, like function param list
00159         PHP_VAR_NODE *var_node;
00160         struct PHP_SCOPE_ITEM *var_si_node;
00161         struct PHP_EXP_NODE *exp_node;
00162     };
00163 };
00164 
00165 typedef struct PHP_EXP_NODE PHP_EXP_NODE;
00166 
00167 typedef struct PHP_LIST_ASSIGN_NODE PHP_LIST_ASSIGN_NODE;
00168 
00169 struct PHP_LIST_ASSIGN_NODE {
00170     int is_list;
00171     union {
00172         PHP_VAR_NODE *var;
00173         PHP_LIST_ASSIGN_NODE *list;
00174     };
00175     PHP_LIST_ASSIGN_NODE *next_node;
00176 };
00177 
00178 typedef struct PHP_FUNC_PARAM_ITEM PHP_FUNC_PARAM_ITEM;
00179 
00180 struct PHP_FUNC_PARAM_ITEM {
00181     char *name;
00182     char *class_name;
00183     int byref;
00184     PHP_FUNC_PARAM_ITEM *next_item;
00185 };
00186 
00187 typedef struct PHP_SYN_NODE PHP_SYN_NODE;
00188 
00189 /*
00190  * Scope table: holding variable definition and declarations for
00191  * functions and classes
00192  * Can be present in several locations:
00193  *  1. Representing stack frame block, inside of called function
00194  *  2. As global scope - holder of global vars, classes and global functions
00195  *  3. At class scope - holder of class members
00196  *  4. Copied to class instanse
00197  * 
00198  */
00199 typedef enum PHP_SCOPE_ITEM_TYPE {
00200     PHP_SCOPE_NONE,
00201     PHP_SCOPE_VAR, PHP_SCOPE_FUNC, PHP_SCOPE_CLASS,
00202     PHP_SCOPE_PARAM
00203 } PHP_SCOPE_ITEM_TYPE;
00204 
00205 
00206 typedef struct PHP_SCOPE_ITEM {
00207     PHP_SCOPE_ITEM_TYPE type;
00208     union {
00209         PHP_VAR_NODE *var;
00210         PHP_SYN_NODE *func;
00211         PHP_SYN_NODE *class_decl;
00212         struct {
00213             PHP_VAR_NODE *var;
00214             int num;
00215         } param;
00216     };
00217 } PHP_SCOPE_ITEM;
00218 
00219 /* thre's stl object behind it */
00220 typedef void *PHP_SCOPE_TABLE;
00221 typedef void *PHP_SCOPE_STACK;
00222 
00223 /*
00224  Syntax tree node, representing 1 statement.
00225 */
00226 typedef enum PHP_STATMENT_TYPE {
00227     PHP_ST_EXPR, PHP_ST_IF,
00228     PHP_ST_WHILE, PHP_ST_DO_WHILE, PHP_ST_FOR, PHP_ST_FOREACH, PHP_ST_SWITCH,
00229     PHP_ST_CONTINUE, PHP_ST_BREAK, PHP_ST_RET,
00230     PHP_ST_FUNC_DECL, PHP_ST_CLASS_DECL,
00231     PHP_ST_ECHO
00232 } PHP_STATMENT_TYPE;
00233 
00234 /* 
00235  * Syntax tree constructs: regular statements and declarations
00236  */
00237 typedef struct PHP_SYN_IF_NODE {
00238     PHP_EXP_NODE *cond;
00239     PHP_SYN_NODE *code_if, *code_else;
00240 } PHP_SYN_IF_NODE;
00241 
00242 typedef struct PHP_SYN_WHILE_NODE {
00243     PHP_EXP_NODE *cond;
00244     PHP_SYN_NODE *code;
00245 } PHP_SYN_WHILE_NODE;
00246 
00247 typedef struct PHP_SYN_FOR_NODE {
00248     PHP_EXP_NODE *do_start, *cond, *do_next;
00249     PHP_SYN_NODE *code;
00250 } PHP_SYN_FOR_NODE;
00251 
00252 typedef struct PHP_SYN_FOREACH_NODE {
00253     PHP_EXP_NODE *elems;
00254     PHP_SCOPE_ITEM *i_key;
00255     PHP_SCOPE_ITEM *i_val;
00256     PHP_SYN_NODE *code;
00257     int byref;
00258 } PHP_SYN_FOREACH_NODE;
00259 
00260 typedef struct PHP_SYN_SWITCH_NODE {
00261     PHP_EXP_NODE *cond;
00262     PHP_EXP_NODE *case_list;
00263 } PHP_SYN_SWITCH_NODE;
00264 
00265 /* for built-in or native functions */
00266 typedef void (*PHP_NATIVE_FUNC_PTR)(PHP_VALUE_NODE *result);
00267 
00268 typedef struct PHP_FUNC_PARAM_DEF {
00269     char *class_name;
00270     int byref;
00271     PHP_VALUE_NODE def_value;
00272     /*
00273      * In PHP, user can choose per-call whether parameter is passed
00274      * by value of by reference. So, save ptr to original varnode,
00275      * for "byvalue" case since we don't have other lvalue to put in
00276      * that scope item.
00277      */
00278     PHP_VAR_NODE *var;
00279     PHP_SCOPE_ITEM *si_var;
00280 } PHP_FUNC_PARAM_DEF;
00281 
00282 
00283 typedef struct PHP_SYN_FUNC_DECL_NODE {
00284     char *name;
00285     PHP_SCOPE_TABLE scope;
00286     int is_native;
00287     union {
00288         PHP_SYN_NODE *code;
00289         PHP_NATIVE_FUNC_PTR native_ptr;
00290     };
00291     int param_count;
00292     PHP_FUNC_PARAM_DEF *params;
00293 } PHP_SYN_FUNC_DECL_NODE;
00294 
00295 /*
00296  * Evaluating $obj->some_field for built-in objects
00297  */
00298 typedef void (*PHP_NATIVE_PROP_GET_FUNC_PTR)(void *obj, char *prop_name, PHP_VALUE_NODE *result);
00299 
00300 typedef struct PHP_SYN_CLASS_DECL_NODE {
00301     int is_native;
00302     char *name;
00303     union {
00304         PHP_SCOPE_TABLE decl_scope;
00305         PHP_NATIVE_PROP_GET_FUNC_PTR native_prop_get_ptr;
00306     };
00307 } PHP_SYN_CLASS_DECL_NODE;
00308 
00309 struct PHP_SYN_NODE {
00310     PHP_STATMENT_TYPE type;
00311     union {
00312         PHP_EXP_NODE            *node_expr;
00313         PHP_SYN_IF_NODE         node_if;
00314         PHP_SYN_WHILE_NODE      node_while;
00315         PHP_SYN_FOREACH_NODE    node_foreach;
00316         PHP_SYN_FOR_NODE        node_for;
00317         PHP_SYN_SWITCH_NODE     node_switch;
00318         PHP_SYN_FUNC_DECL_NODE  *func_decl;
00319         PHP_SYN_CLASS_DECL_NODE *class_decl;
00320     };
00321     PHP_SYN_NODE *next_node;
00322 };
00323 
00324 /*
00325  * Interface to lib of built-in functions, classes, variables
00326  */
00327 /*
00328  * Using fixed size array will allow "in-place" definition 
00329  * of built-in functions without pointer mess.
00330  * 
00331  */
00332 #define PHP_MAX_FUNC_PARAM   16
00333 
00334 typedef struct PHP_BLTIN_FUNC_DEF {
00335     const char *name;
00336     int param_count;
00337     PHP_NATIVE_FUNC_PTR func;
00338 } PHP_BLTIN_FUNC_DEF;

00484     /*
00485      * Return code meaning:
00486      *  0  : continue execution to the next statement
00487      *  +x : return and skip current loop cycle, as "continue expr" means
00488      *  -x : return and break as "break expr" means
00489      *  In non-loop situation any != 0 code means "return"
00490      */

00535 typedef std::map<std::string, PHP_VAR_NODE *>::iterator PHP_ARRAY_ITER_TYPE;
00536 typedef std::list<std::string>::iterator PHP_ARRAY_KEY_ITER_TYPE;
00537 //
00538 // In php arrays are behave like hashes (i.e. associative) and are sortable.
00539 // STL std::map is not sortable.
00540 //
00541 typedef struct {
00542     std::map<std::string, PHP_VAR_NODE *> array;
00543     std::list<std::string> sorted_keys;
00544     PHP_ARRAY_KEY_ITER_TYPE current;
00545 } PHP_ARRAY_TYPE;
00546 
00547 //
00548 // using std::string instead of "char *" so keys will be compared 
00549 // by string value
00550 typedef std::map<std::string, PHP_SCOPE_ITEM *> PHP_SCOPE_TABLE_TYPE;
00551 typedef std::list<PHP_SCOPE_TABLE_TYPE *> PHP_SCOPE_STACK_TYPE;
00552 
00553 const std::string &array_get_ith_key(PHP_VALUE_NODE *array, int i);
00554 PHP_VAR_NODE *array_get_by_str_key(PHP_VALUE_NODE *array, std::string key);
00555 void array_add_to_str_key(PHP_VALUE_NODE *array, std::string key, PHP_VAR_NODE *node);
00556 void array_remove_at_str_key(PHP_VALUE_NODE *array, std::string key);

00559     PHP_SCOPE_TABLE_TYPE *scope_map, PHP_VALUE_NODE *arg_array,
00560     std::map<std::string, PHP_VAR_NODE *> &saved_vars);

00562 
00563 #endif
